property.description: HOCO must be enabled out of reset because the MCU starts up in low voltage mode and the HOCO must be operating in low voltage mode.

option.display: HOCO oscillation is enabled after reset

property.description: Use the low voltage mode. This limits the ICLK operating frequency to 4 MHz and requires all clock dividers to be at least 4 when oscillation stop detection is used.

constraint.display: Value must be an integer between 0 and 0x000FFFFC (ROM) or between 0x1FF00000 and 0x200FFFFC (RAM)
Value must be an integer between 0x00000003 and 0x000FFFFF (ROM) or between 0x1FF00003 and 0x200FFFFF (RAM)
Value must be an integer between 0 and 0x000FFFFC (ROM) or between 0x1FF00000 and 0x200FFFFC (RAM)
Value must be an integer between 0x00000003 and 0x000FFFFF (ROM) or between 0x1FF00003 and 0x200FFFFF (RAM)
Value must be an integer between 0 and 0x000FFFFC
Value must be an integer between 0x00000003 and 0x000FFFFF
Value must be an integer between 0x1FF00000 and 0x200FFFFC
Value must be an integer between 0x1FF00003 and 0x200FFFFF
Value must be an integer between 0x400C0000 and 0x400DFFFC or between 0x40100000 and 0x407FFFFC
Value must be an integer between 0x400C0003 and 0x400DFFFF or between 0x40100003 and 0x407FFFFF
Value must be an integer between 0x400C0000 and 0x400DFFFC or between 0x40100000 and 0x407FFFFC
Value must be an integer between 0x400C0003 and 0x400DFFFF or between 0x40100003 and 0x407FFFFF

property.description: Number of cycles to wait for the main oscillator clock to stabilize.

When set to 'Locked with All Erase support', the ID Code must be set in the debugger to read or write data to the MCU, but the All Erase command is still accepted regardless. When set to 'Locked', all erase/download/debug access is disabled unless the ID Code is provided.
Set the ID Code for locking debug access. This setting is only used when the ID Code Mode is not set to Unlocked.

constraint.display: Value must be a 32 character long hex string

property.export: eval(' \ value = ("${config.bsp.common.id_mode}" == "0xFFFFFFFF") ? "FFFFFFFF" : ("${config.bsp.common.id_code}" + "FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF").substring(0, 8), \ /* convert to little endian */ \ value.substring(6, 8) + value.substring(4, 6) + value.substring(2, 4) + value.substring(0, 2) \ ')

eval(' \ value = ("${config.bsp.common.id_mode}" == "0xFFFFFFFF") ? "FFFFFFFF" : ("${config.bsp.common.id_code}" + "FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF").substring(8, 16), \ /* convert to little endian */ \ value.substring(6, 8) + value.substring(4, 6) + value.substring(2, 4) + value.substring(0, 2) \ ')

eval(' \ value = ("${config.bsp.common.id_mode}" == "0xFFFFFFFF") ? "FFFFFFFF" : ("${config.bsp.common.id_code}" + "FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF").substring(16, 24), \ /* convert to little endian */ \ value.substring(6, 8) + value.substring(4, 6) + value.substring(2, 4) + value.substring(0, 2) \ ')

eval(' \ value = ("${config.bsp.common.id_mode}" == "0xFFFFFFFF") ? "FFFFFFFF" : ("${config.bsp.common.id_code}" + "FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF").substring(24, 32), \ high_id_byte = parseInt(value.substring(6, 8), 16), \ high_mode_byte = parseInt(("${config.bsp.common.id_mode}").substring(2, 4), 16), \ high_byte = ((high_id_byte & 0x3F) | high_mode_byte).toString(16), \ /* convert to little endian */ \ high_byte + value.substring(4, 6) + value.substring(2, 4) + value.substring(0, 2)')

eval(' \ value = ("${config.bsp.common.id_code}" + "FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF"), \ low_bytes = value.substring(0,30), \ high_id_byte = parseInt(value.substring(29, 32), 16), \ high_mode_byte = parseInt(("${config.bsp.common.id_mode}").substring(2, 4), 16), \ /* add 0x100 to force string to be padded */ \ high_byte = (0x100 + ((high_id_byte & 0x3F) | high_mode_byte)).toString(16).substring(1,3), \ ("${config.bsp.common.id_mode}" == "0xFFFFFFFF") ? "FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF" : low_bytes + high_byte')

constraint.display: The system clock source must be greater than 0.
ICLK must not be less than PCLKB
PCLKD must not be less than PCLKB
ICLK must not be less than FCLK
CLKOUT divider must be 2 if MOCO is selected as the CLKOUT source
Maximum allowed XTAL frequency for RA2A1 is 20MHz

node.tooltip: Click to edit the XTAL frequency.
The system clock (ICLK) is used as the operating clock of the CPU, DTC, ROM and RAM. \nMaximum frequency is 48 MHz.
The Peripheral clock B (PCLKB) is used as the operating clock for all other modules not supported by PCLKD. \nMaximum frequency is 32 MHz.

The Peripheral clock D (PCLKD) is used as the operating clock for the GPT (count clock) module and ADC16.\nWhen ADC16 is not used PCLKD cannot exceed 64MHz. When ADC16 is used PCLKD must be at least 1MHz and cannot exceed 32MHz.

The flash-interface clock (FCLK) is used as the operating clock for the flash-memory interfaces.\nThat is, FCLK is used for programming and erasure of the ROM and E2 DataFlash, and reading from the E2 DataFlash. \nOutput frequency must be between 1 MHz and 32 MHz when any of these operations are used.
The USB clock (UCLK) is an operating clock for the USBFS module.\nA 48-MHz clock must be supplied to the USB module.\nWhen the USB module is used, setting must be made so that UCLK is 48 MHz.

The Sigma-Delta A/D converter clock (SDADCCLK) is an operating clock for the 24-bit Sigma-Delta A/D Converter module.\nWhen the SDADC module is used, the setting must be made so that the SDADC clock is 4 MHz.
Frequency output on the CLKOUT pin if CLKOUT is enabled. \nMaximum frequency is 16 MHz.

event.display: ICU|ICU SNOOZE CANCEL (Canceling from Snooze mode)
CGC|CGC MOSC STOP (Main Clock oscillation stop)
ADC|ADC0|ADC0 SCAN END (A/D scan end interrupt)
ADC|ADC0|ADC0 SCAN END B (A/D scan end interrupt for group B)
ADC|ADC0|ADC0 WINDOW A (Window A Compare match)
ADC|ADC0|ADC0 WINDOW B (Window B Compare match)
CTSU|CTSU READ (Measurement data transfer request interrupt)
POEG|POEG0|POEG0 EVENT (Port Output disable interrupt A)
POEG|POEG1|POEG1 EVENT (Port Output disable interrupt B)
SDADC|SDADC0|SDADC0 ADI (End of SD A/D conversion)
SDADC|SDADC0|SDADC0 SCANEND (End of SD A/D scan)
SDADC|SDADC0|SDADC0 CALIEND (End of SD A/D A/D calibration)
GPT|GPT0|GPT0 CAPTURE COMPARE A (Compare match A)
GPT|GPT0|GPT0 CAPTURE COMPARE B (Compare match B)
GPT|GPT1|GPT1 CAPTURE COMPARE A (Compare match A)
GPT|GPT1|GPT1 CAPTURE COMPARE B (Compare match B)
GPT|GPT2|GPT2 CAPTURE COMPARE A (Compare match A)
GPT|GPT2|GPT2 CAPTURE COMPARE B (Compare match B)

GPT|GPT3|GPT3 CAPTURE COMPARE B (Compare match B)

GPT|GPT5|GPT5 CAPTURE COMPARE A (Compare match A)

GPT|GPT6|GPT6 CAPTURE COMPARE B (Compare match B)
SCI|SCI0|SCI0 RXI OR ERI (Receive data full/Receive)
